author: Alice
content: Has anyone tested the new API version yet? I'm getting timeout errors.

author: Bob
content: Yes, I had the same issue. Try increasing the timeout setting in your config.

author: Alice
content: Thanks! What's the recommended value?

author: Charlie
content: For production environments, we typically use 60000ms (60 seconds).

author: Bob
content: That matches our experience. Also check the connection pool settings.

author: Diana
content: I wrote a quick guide for API configuration: https://docs.example.org/api-config

author: Emma
content: The documentation is really helpful! One question - what are the hardware requirements for running a node?

author: Frank
content: Minimum specs: 8-core CPU, 16GB RAM, 500GB SSD. Recommended: 16-core, 32GB RAM.

author: Emma
content: Perfect, thanks! I'll set up a test environment this week.

author: George
content: Don't forget to check the network configuration too. Port 8080 needs to be open.

author: Henry
content: We're seeing intermittent connection drops. Anyone else experiencing this?

author: Diana
content: What version are you running? There was a bug fixed in 2.1.3.

author: Henry
content: We're on 2.1.2. I'll try upgrading.

author: Diana
content: That should fix it. Let us know how it goes.

author: Henry
content: Will do, thanks for the quick response!

author: Ivan
content: New release notes are out: https://docs.example.org/releases/2.2.0

author: Julia
content: Great timing! We were waiting for the database connection pooling improvements.

author: Kevin
content: The migration guide is excellent. Upgraded 50 nodes without issues.

author: Laura
content: For anyone having trouble with the upgrade, the CLI command is: cli upgrade --version 2.2.0

author: Mike
content: I keep getting permission errors when running the CLI. Anyone know the fix?

author: Nancy
content: Try running with sudo, or check your user permissions in the config directory.

author: Mike
content: That was it! Thanks Nancy.

author: Oliver
content: Another common issue: make sure your PATH includes the bin directory.

author: Patricia
content: Good tip. I always add it to my .bashrc to avoid confusion.

author: Quinn
content: Has the security audit been completed for 2.2.0?

author: Rachel
content: Yes, the report is linked in the release notes. All critical issues resolved.

author: Sam
content: Deployment automation script is available at: https://github.com/example-org/deploy-scripts

author: Tom
content: Works great with both Docker and Kubernetes deployments.

author: Uma
content: What's the recommended monitoring setup?

author: Victor
content: We use Prometheus + Grafana. Dashboards are in the monitoring repo.
